modules.description: Converts command-line arguments between string representations and a structured type, enabling safe parsing and serialization. Operates on a custom type `t` that encapsulates command data. Used to validate user input and generate output for system execution.

Creates a sequence of commands to execute, with an option to log output to a file. Processes command structures and array elements, enabling structured execution flows. Used to define and manage command pipelines with optional logging for debugging or auditing.

Provides functions to parse, validate, and serialize job submission scripts in a PBS (Portable Batch System) format. Operates on strings and custom record types representing job directives and commands. Used to generate valid PBS script files from structured data and to extract configuration details from existing scripts.

Encapsulates command-line arguments in a structured type for safe parsing and serialization, and constructs executable command sequences with optional logging. Supports validation of user input and generation of system-ready outputs. Enables the creation of complex pipelines by processing command structures and array elements. Can be used to build reliable scripts that execute sequences of commands while maintaining traceable logs.

Pbs_qstat processes and extracts information from qstat output, parsing it into a structured format and providing access to job-specific data like IDs and status. It handles errors during parsing and status retrieval, returning detailed error messages for malformed input or missing fields. It supports converting job statuses and errors to human-readable strings for logging or user feedback.
